comments.message: I believe in bringing out the Super Hero in them and develop their resilience and grit through sports. They stay active through swimming, running and going for many races to challenge themselves!

liked & shared
hope can win for it
Paul Chan Ng Teck Son Shu Zhen Ma Joseph Chrysostom Kartik Manokaran Ajay Ying Ying
Getting down to the gym a couple days a week and having low-fat milk in your morning latte isn’t going to make much of a dent in a system or lifestyle that is essentially, well, unwell.
Yoga not only keeping me active; it also helps me to de-stress
I keep myself fit by hitting the treadmill every day. short distance in fast pace shall suffice to maintain my fitness....
Since there is a stadium near my place; why shouldn't I make use of it. Enjoy doing my night run at the track every evening shall clear my mind from work stress...

Liked and shared!!! 

I would bring them to the natural park, go for event together. At least once a week. Health is important to everyone and build a good relationship with one another. 

Paul ChanChloe YiKartik Manokaran AjayJoseph ChrysostomShu Zhen Ma

Good luck everyone!!
My 5 years old goes to the track with me all time and at least made an effort to run at least 1 round. Her favorite exercise is bear crawl, I crawl she sit 🤢 #Aroo #spartanracesg #bmw
Keeping myself with the spin classes. At fast pace; I am able to build up my stamina

I will definitely gym and run at least trice a week! As a hobby and a past cca, I will occasionally swim and canoe too. Plus, my fitbit is on my wrist 24/7 to make sure I stay active throughout the day, even if it’s a work day!😎✌🏽

Since they were young, my wife and I encourage our two kids to expose to different sports: swimming, tennis, ice skating, table tennis, golf. And we tried Bukit Timah Hill, overseas mountain climbing, to expose them to various sports activities that they will enjoy. But we don’t force them to do it if they don’t enjoy it. In the meantime, we set an example by having our weekly mountain trail walks, tennis and jogging at Park Connectors. This help to get the family together into enjoying various sports.
My 9-year-old daughter goes for track training at the stadium at least twice a week and occasionally runs around the estate. I climb the stairs at work. Together, we have pillow and bolster fights.

I make sure that I head to the gym for regular workout at least twice a week, and also bring my kids out for running to keep them strong and healthy, as well as help them improve their stamina. It helps to strengthen our family bonding and motivate us to stay fit.
I walk the stairs together with my 5 yr old; at times he would get tired and I ended up piggy back him.. double work out.. lol

I’m in my school canoeing team and a dragonboat club. Thus, I commit myself to both sports for most of the days a week. Additionally, I will gym with my team mates at least twice a week and during my free time as well. 🙂💪
always being disciplined to find time to gym/run or any other forms of exercise. would love to get free passes to Spartan Race in SG!
I keep myself fit by running thrice a week at the park, sweating myself out & most importantly maintain my discipline of not giving up!

A family who works out together will stay together!
👦🏻👩🏻 +👧🏻👦🏻

We stay active by doing the various outdoor activities together, hiking, cycling, in-line skating, water parks, kayaking and more to mention!

I hope to be able to win the free adult sprint race to join my 2 children who are doing the kids race. 

Thank you so much BMW Singapore! ❤️❤️
As a boy, kiddo simply loves the outdoor, and I never say no to such great opportunities to bond and create wonderful memories 💪🏻
Walking is the easiest exercise. A walk in Henderson Bridge or thru the mall ... as long as we get off the couch its half the battle won
I always plan & schedule my kids to stay physically active by doing Weekend family jogging, swimming & cycling in the morning follow by having their favourite breakfast at MC Donald!

My 8-year old daughter is active in all kinds of sports, such as running, kids Ironman, ice skating, in-line skating, ski, snorkeling, trampling and more... She also has been having regular training on ballet, gymnastics and Taekwondo for years. Why not add the Spartan Kids to her checklist?💪
We eat healthily together, we exercise together & we read together, So as a family we try to exercise and have our healthy habits TOGETHER...

To me the word active defines, as getting mentally and physically fit towards a healthy lifestyle in food  and activities to get the right BMI and Muscle Mass. 

As working as a chef career it's hard to maintain a lifestyle of both,as it requires long hours of standing & cooking. 
Even though it's a tough job but I like to see my customer satisfaction .

I  took on many sport such as  golf , running,  swimming , bungy jump, squash , archery  , hip- hop dancer, Triathlon, obstacle course, rock climbing , AFF certified skydiver  and waking up 4am in the morning everyday  for 15km run before heading for F45 gym class for 45mins of functional Training before going to work . Daily routine for straight 2 years and my role model is the Dwayne Johnson. 

I know that the BMW brand itself the vision is 
*We are Number ONE.
*We inspire people on the move: 
(Which inspire me to get more active and to help out more people in getting a active and a healthy  lifestyle living. )

I hope that it could inspire more people & i hope to win the passes as well.

Kids need to be motivated when staying active is our.presence doing the exercises together such as getting the kids to come to Daddy or Mummy. We learn skating , swimming together.  The parents' presence.is the source of motivator to have kids staying physically active and grow interest in sports.
I do TRI, my kid do dance, weekend we walk shopping centers....rest and eat as rest and eat nutrition is part of training....

We are giving away 10 free passes to the Spartan Sprint Race (worth up to $158 each) and 10 free passes to Spartan Kids Race (worth $68 each) at Sentosa on 24 March 2018. What’s more, you will receive exclusive access to the BMW VIP tent on that day. 

Simply share with us in the comments below how you or your kid stay physically active and you could be one of the 20 lucky winners*! Contest ends on 15 March 2018 (Thursday).

The Spartan Sprint/Kids Race is presented by BMW. *Terms and Conditions apply.

comments.message:
Sharing the experience of a close Friend who recently bought a BMW 7 and had a terrible feeling

Here is the story of how we got royally ‘cheated’ by BMW – if you love BMWs or if you are planning on buying a BMW, please read this beforehand. The company truly does not care about you the second the sale is made (this is coming from an avid BMW fan and customer).

A little under 6 months ago I purchased a BMW from BMW Singapore. I bought a brand new 740Li with all the bells and whistles which set me back a little over a massive $450,000 (yes in Singapore that’s the price you end up paying – a part of your entire net worth and yet they take you for a ride).

Anyhow, I picked up the car from their showroom after 6months of waiting for the car to be delivered and it did not take long before I started noticing all technical faults in the car! The second day I called back because my speed limit indication was not popping up. It went downhill from there. The second I mentioned it they told me my car did not have it although it was very clearly specified at the time of purchase and through the test drives that we will indeed get this feature. We even told them that we will pay for it after which we were informed that the feature was available just not for ‘our car’. This is when my suspicion first started that they gave me a refurbished piece of junk instead of a new car.

Here are a list of all the issues the car is already showing (mind you the car is less than 6months old and I paid over $450,000 for it!)
1. Technical failure with speed limit indication which can’t be fixed specifically for ‘our car’.
2. The car came with a stain on the back seat which we have no way of proving that it was not us so we are dropping it altogether.
3. The keys don’t actually connect to the driver profiles we have selected and regardless of which key you enter with, it just gives you the last settings. This is something BMW really prides itself on but it really shouldn’t because that is just straight up cheating people.
4. The screen is already starting to flicker from time to time.
5. The big key they give you with the 7 series to drive your car literally never retains its battery.
6. The camera they have mounted in my car has already melted off the windscreen and so how has the ERP card machine (photos attached). This is probably from them trying to make extra money by buying cheap adhesives to glue things to your windscreen on an already overpriced car. (check out the photos – it is so painful its almost funny)
I went down to the The Consumers Association of Singapore (CASE), whom after reviewing our case, sent a letter to BMW on our behalf. BMWs response? Nothing – radio silence. So above and beyond just ignoring our calls, they are also actively ignoring CASE. 

I have come down to a point of desperation and without knowing what else to do I am posting this here so hopefully anyone else that has been swindled out of their money by BMW or otherwise can help me re target this to raise awareness. 

If there are any publications that wish to carry this as text, video or otherwise you have my permission and if you require any assistance with the formatting please write to me.

I have already submitted this to all the news/publication outlets I can and it should start popping up everywhere fairly soon.

Also for those who care, the reason BMW in Singapore could not care less is because the people who own BMW in Singapore pretty much own most other prominent dealerships so they know there is nothing the common man can do to them.

#toobigtoofall #bmw #cheatedbybmw #needhelp #customerservice
